1 Introduction

This project delved into the Lightcast labor market dataset utilizing PySpark and Plotly, advancing from exploratory data analysis and visualization to sophisticated regression modeling and large-scale machine learning. Each lab emphasized the development of technical, analytical, and visual communication skills through structured objectives and the processing of real-world data workflows.

2 Lab 01 â€” Visual Reporting and Storytelling

Key Objectives:
â€¢ Successfully loaded and analyzed the Lightcast dataset within a Spark DataFrame.
â€¢ Developed Plotly visualizations to examine:
â—¦ Salary distributions
â—¦ Employment trends
â—¦ Job postings
â€¢ Investigated the relationship between skills and NAICS/SOC/ONET codes concerning salaries.
â€¢ Enhanced the readability and presentation of visualizations by customizing colors, fonts, and styles.
â€¢ Implemented best practices for effective data communication.
â€¢ Compiled and presented results in both Jupyter Notebook and HTML formats.

3 Lab 02 â€” Insight from Data and Visualizations

Key Objectives:
â€¢ Processed the Lightcast dataset using PySpark before converting it to Pandas for visualization purposes.
â€¢ Created advanced scatter plots and histograms to analyze:
â—¦ Education levels
â—¦ Categories of remote work
â€¢ Imputed missing salary data by using group medians for accuracy.
â€¢ Visualized salary distributions based on:
â—¦ Experience
â—¦ Education
â—¦ Remote setting
â€¢ Provided clear written insights for each chart to elucidate key trends.

4 Lab 03 â€” Regression Modeling on Employment Data

Key Objectives:
â€¢ Conducted regression analysis on the Lightcast dataset utilizing PySpark.
â€¢ Engineered predictive features derived from structured columns relevant to salary data.
â€¢ Trained a Linear Regression model aimed at salary prediction.
â€¢ Evaluated the modelâ€™s performance using RMSE and RÂ² metrics.
â€¢ Created diagnostic plots to visualize predictions and assess model accuracy.

5 Lab 04 â€” Machine Learning on Scale

Key Objectives:
â€¢ Employed PySpark for the large-scale processing of the Lightcast dataset.
â€¢ Engineered structured features suitable for salary prediction at scale.
â€¢ Trained and validated a Linear Regression model using distributed data effectively.
â€¢ Assessed model results using RMSE and RÂ² metrics.
â€¢ Developed diagnostic visualizations to evaluate predictive performance and identify model patterns.e and detect model patterns.

# Introduction
This project delved into the Lightcast labor market dataset utilizing PySpark and Plotly, advancing from exploratory data analysis and visualization to sophisticated regression modeling and large-scale machine learning. Each lab emphasized the development of technical, analytical, and visual communication skills through structured objectives and the processing of real-world data workflows.

# Lab 01 â€” Visual Reporting and Storytelling

**Key Objectives:**  
â€¢ Successfully loaded and analyzed the Lightcast dataset within a Spark DataFrame.  
â€¢ Developed Plotly visualizations to examine:  
  â—¦ Salary distributions  
  â—¦ Employment trends  
  â—¦ Job postings  
â€¢ Investigated the relationship between skills and NAICS/SOC/ONET codes concerning salaries.  
â€¢ Enhanced the readability and presentation of visualizations by customizing colors, fonts, and styles.  
â€¢ Implemented best practices for effective data communication.  
â€¢ Compiled and presented results in both Jupyter Notebook and HTML formats.

# Lab 02 â€” Insight from Data and Visualizations
**Key Objectives:**  
â€¢ Processed the Lightcast dataset using PySpark before converting it to Pandas for visualization purposes.  
â€¢ Created advanced scatter plots and histograms to analyze:  
  â—¦ Education levels  
  â—¦ Categories of remote work  
â€¢ Imputed missing salary data by using group medians for accuracy.  
â€¢ Visualized salary distributions based on:  
  â—¦ Experience  
  â—¦ Education  
  â—¦ Remote setting  
â€¢ Provided clear written insights for each chart to elucidate key trends.

# Lab 03 â€” Regression Modeling on Employment Data
**Key Objectives:**  
â€¢ Conducted regression analysis on the Lightcast dataset utilizing PySpark.  
â€¢ Engineered predictive features derived from structured columns relevant to salary data.  
â€¢ Trained a Linear Regression model aimed at salary prediction.  
â€¢ Evaluated the model's performance using RMSE and RÂ² metrics.  
â€¢ Created diagnostic plots to visualize predictions and assess model accuracy.

# Lab 04 â€” Machine Learning on Scale
**Key Objectives:**  
â€¢ Employed PySpark for the large-scale processing of the Lightcast dataset.  
â€¢ Engineered structured features suitable for salary prediction at scale.  
â€¢ Trained and validated a Linear Regression model using distributed data effectively.  
â€¢ Assessed model results using RMSE and RÂ² metrics.  
â€¢ Developed diagnostic visualizations to evaluate predictive performance and identify model patterns.e and detect model patterns.
